DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator that asks whether patients receiving therapy or interventions have agreed to prevent pregnancy until the end of therapy or interventions.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the patient's agreement to use effective contraception during protocol treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The prevention of conception or impregnation by the use of devices or drugs or surgery.

Concepts.definition: The prevention of conception or impregnation by the use of devices or drugs or surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: 1. The act of agreeing. 2. Harmony of opinion; accord. (from American Heritage Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a yes/no indicator, related to reproduction, that may contain other related answers (e.g., Not assessed).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

PermissibleValues.value: NA patient is not of reproductive potential
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: N/A, patient is not of reproductive potential

ValueMeaning.preferredName: N/A, patient is not of reproductive potential
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: N/A, patient is not of reproductive potential

PermissibleValues.value: NA patient is not sexually active
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NA patient is not sexually active

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NA patient is not sexually active
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: NA patient is not sexually active

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If male, does patient agree to use a latex condom during sexual contact with a female of child bearing potential, even if they have had a successful vasectomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is of childbearing potential, is she practicing an effective method of birth control?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient agreed to use an effective contraceptive method for the duration of the study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text 23

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient agreed to use an effective contraceptive method for the duration of  protocol therapy and for at least 12 weeks after stopping study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient agreed to use an effective contraceptive method for the duration of their study participation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text  001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient agreed to use an effective contraceptive method for the duration of their study participation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Contraception Agreed Ind

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient agreed to use con
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient agreed to use contraception during protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient willing to use contraceptive techniques during the length of lenalidomide maintenance therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is of childbearing potential, has she agreed to use contraceptive measures during study therapy and for at least 6 months after completion of Bevacizumab therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is of child bearing potential, has she agreed to use an accepted and effective method of contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control; abstinence) from the time of signing the informed consent through the duration of being on study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has the capacity to become pregnant, has she agreed to use an accepted and effective non-hormonal method of contraception i.e., double barrier method (eg. condom plus diaphragm) from the time of signing the informed consent through six months after the last dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient agreed to practice an effective form of contraception during the study and for at least three months after receiving the final treatment of Brivanib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has the capacity to become pregnant, has she agreed to use adequate contraception (two barrier methods of birth control) prior to study entry and for the duration of the study and up to three months after the final dose of BIBF1120?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is she willing to exercise an effective form of birth control during radiation therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If randomized to receive radiation therapy, did the woman agree to use contraception as defined in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to use adequate contraception when sexually active and to continue contraception for 6 months after study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient and her sexual partner(s) agree to use adequate contraception when sexually active for the duration of the study and for 6 months after finishing study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 30
